page.title: 02INDUSTRY
page.content: The only industry in Bishopton is the Royal Ordnance Factory (R.O.F.). It was established in 1917. Its products contribute towards armaments for Britain and are also exported to other countries. It is due to be privatised in the near future. There have been a number of explosions, but none causing a major disaster. Most of what goes on inside the factory is top secret. South of the village is a deserted quarry which was a source of basalt for building. Many of the residents of Bishopton work in industries in nearby large towns, e.g. shipyards and I.B.M. in Greenock, Babcock Engineering in Renfrew and Coats in Paisley.
